results.title: Morning in the streets
results.creator_credit: Roy Harris, Denis Mitchell and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: An impression of life and opinion in the back streets of a northern industrial city in England, showing the warmth, the vitality and humor. In the early morning the streets are drab and wet but gradually they awaken, to human sounds and movements. The film ends at midday when the children come out of school, their shouts and songs drowning the voices of the old. (Award: Italia)

results.title: Morning glory
results.creator_credit: Lowell Sherman, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn collected her first Academy Award for her masterful performance in “Morning glory”. Cast to type as a garrulous New Englander who arrives in New York with one burning ambition - to be an actress - she delivered an effervescent performance. Based on the play by Zoe Akins.

results.title: Mork & Mindy
results.creator_credit: Henderson Productions, Miller-Milkis Productions, Paramount Television, Brian Levant, Garry Marshall, Anthony W. Marshall, Dale McRaven and Bruce Johnson
results.brief_description: Mork & Mindy is an American science fiction sitcom broadcast from 1978 until 1982. The series starred Robin Williams as Mork, an alien who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in a small, one-man egg-shaped spaceship.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Henderson Productions, Miller-Milkis Productions, Paramount Television, Brian Levant, Garry Marshall, Anthony W. Marshall, Dale McRaven and Bruce Johnson
results.description: Mork & Mindy is an American science fiction sitcom broadcast from 1978 until 1982 on ABC. The series starred Robin Williams as Mork, an alien who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in a small, one-man egg-shaped spaceship. Pam Dawber co-starred as Mindy McConnell, his human friend and roommate. In 1997, the episode “Mork’s Mixed Emotions” was ranked #94 on TV Guide’s 100 Greatest Episodes of All Time list.
description_for_label: Mork & Mindy is an American science fiction sitcom broadcast from 1978 until 1982 on ABC. The series starred Robin Williams as Mork, an alien who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in a small, one-man egg-shaped spaceship. Pam Dawber co-starred as Mindy McConnell, his human friend and roommate. In 1997, the episode “Mork’s Mixed Emotions” was ranked #94 on TV Guide’s 100 Greatest Episodes of All Time list.

results.title: Morgan Stewart's coming home
results.creator_credit: Alan Smithee, Stephen J. Friedman and Kings Road Entertainment
results.brief_description: For the first time since he was a young boy, teenager Morgan Stewart (Jon Cryer) is invited by his parents to make the move from boarding school to home. Packing up his dorm room, Morgan sets out with high hopes that are swiftly quashed as it becomes apparent that his parents invited him home as a political move, eager to impress voters with the “family” push. When he meets the down to earth and wrong side of the tracks girl, Emily (Viveka Davis), Morgan is forced to choose between pursuing his own interests and maintaining the awkward sense of family. In the process Morgan discovers corruption by his father’s campaign press secretary (Paul Gleason) which also challenges his sense of familial loyalty. Cast also includes Nicholas Pryor and Lynn Redgrave.

results.title: Moresby under the blitz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel. This issue is a film by Damien Parer of the war in New Guinea, including his dramatic footage of the bombing of the Macdhul.

results.title: Morehu
results.brief_description: Rita Morrison’s mother died three days after the 9/11 terrorist attacks. Her grief would link these two events forever. This digital story was created in partnership with the Koorie heritage Trust.

results.title: More Winners: Boy Soldiers
results.creator_credit: Cliff Green, Mark Joffe, Margot McDonald, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Quartier Latin International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
In 1910 the Australian Government passed a law requiring all boys aged between 14 and 17 years of age to register for compulsory military training. Between 1911 and 1915, more than 30,000 boys were persecuted for failing to obey this law. This story tells of one such boy, Will Barnes, a 14 year old conscientious objector who refuses to register. After prosecution Will is sentenced to three months training at Fort Queenscliff. At the fort, Will refuses to wear a uniform or to be involved in any type of military training. Will meets a lot of opposition but also wins his share of admirers, for sticking to his beliefs.

Cast includes Tamblyn Lord, Nathan Croft, Bruno Lawrence, Nicholas Bell and Gary Sweet.

results.title: More Winners Series
results.brief_description: A second series of highly acclaimed television programs for children. ‘Winners’ and ‘More Winners’ are anthology series of fourteen telemovies, featuring historical drama, comedy, science fiction, fantasy, adventure and social realism. Each film celebrates individuality and the facing of difficult situations with courage and ingenuity.
